aboutUsContent.1: Saint Crois is a non-commercial platform created to make it easier for teachers and students to find language exercises, so you no longer have to spend hours searching for tasks across scattered sources. We offer a unified database where exercises are organized by levels, topics, and language features.
aboutUsContent.2: We focus on practice and clarity. Materials are structured so that you can quickly find the right task for a specific goal: grammar, vocabulary, pronunciation, writing, and speaking skills.
aboutUsContent.3: The system is actively evolving. We add new exercises every day, expand the coverage of levels and language areas, improve navigation, selection criteria, and enhance functionality.
aboutUsContent.4: If you are ready to help with development â€” write to
aboutUsContent.5: We welcome objective feedback, help with content, as well as any reviews of our platform. Your support is important to us!

teamContent.1: We are a small but close-knit team of volunteers from different corners of Europe. We are united by a common goal â€” to gather as many diverse exercises as possible to make language learning simpler, more engaging, and more effective.
teamContent.2: It all started from our own need: we were looking for high-quality and exciting tasks ourselves, so that the difficult process of learning would become easier and even fun. Now we are working on a single platform that helps both teachers and language learners. The project is entirely volunteer-based and non-commercial â€” our main goal is not profit, but benefit for the community.
teamContent.4: Andriy Latyshev â€” the visionary, ideologist, and project leader.
teamContent.5: Kateryna Ihnatova â€” UI/UX designer, thanks to whom the platform is not only convenient but also visually appealing.
teamContent.6: Oleksii Domkin â€” frontend developer who brings design ideas to life.
teamContent.7: Yevhen Zlobin, Olena Didenko, and Ivan â€” backend developers who ensured the correct, fast, and stable work of the entire system.
teamContent.8: Karyna Latysheva â€” content manager, author of most exercises on the platform, thanks to whom the database grows every day.
teamContent.9: Our team is small, but this is exactly what makes us flexible, fast, and dedicated to our work.

faq.a1: An exercise platform for language learning. A unified database of tasks organized by levels, topics, and language features. The goal is to remove the chaos of 'googling exercises' and provide quick access to the right practice.
faq.a2-1: Learners close specific gaps with practice: we know how difficult it can be to find a good set of exercises for certain topics, so we offer an all-in-one solution.
faq.a2-2: Teachers quickly gather sets of exercises for lessons, and we are also developing features for easy sharing of materials and student progress checking.
faq.q3: How is Saint Crois different from ordinary collections and blogs?
faq.a3: Systematization and searchability. Exercises are structured by levels/topics/skills (vocabulary, grammar, pronunciation, writing/speaking), not by 'posts'. Minimum actions, maximum practice.
faq.q4: What languages and levels are available?
faq.a4: We start with major European languages and levels A1â€“B2.
faq.a4-1: The range expands as the database grows. Check the specific list on the site filters.
faq.q5: How often do new exercises appear?
faq.a5: Daily. The database is updated and reviewed, old tasks are improved, tags are refined.
faq.a6: A team of volunteers. The project is non-commercial.
faq.a6-1: The goal is to provide the community with a convenient practice tool.
faq.q7: Is the platform free to use?
faq.a7: Yes. Basic scenarios are free. If paid features appear, they will be clearly marked. Priority â€” free access to practical content.
faq.q8: How do search and filters work?
faq.a8: Search by level, topic, skill type, task format. Combine filters for precise results. If a tag is missing â€” write to us, weâ€™ll add it.
faq.q9: Can I propose my own exercises?
faq.a9: Yes. Send materials with short instructions, answers/keys, and notes on level/skill.
faq.a9-1: We validate the methodology, structure, and publish with author attribution.
faq.a10: Two-step review: methodological (goal, level, skill type) and editorial (instruction clarity, key correctness, tag consistency). Errors are fixed, disputed tasks are sent for revision.
faq.q11: Can the materials be used in lessons and courses?
faq.a11-1: For republication outside the platform, check the licensing conditions of the specific material with us by email.
faq.q12: Are there accounts, progress tracking, bookmarks?
faq.a12: The basic version â€” no extra friction: open, filter, solve.
faq.a12-1: As development progresses, weâ€™ll add bookmarks/collections and progress saving.
faq.q13: Whatâ€™s the development plan for the near future?
faq.a13-1: Expand the database by levels and languages.
faq.a13-3: Sets for typical lessons and micro-skills.
faq.a13-4: Tools for teachers (collections, handouts, key export).
faq.a13-5: In-task feedback (report an error / suggest an improvement).
faq.a13-6: Functionality for easy sharing of exercises with students and progress tracking.

contactsContent.1: Saint Crois is a volunteer non-commercial project. We are open to questions, ideas, and collaboration. If you want to propose an exercise, report an error, or help with the development of the platform â€” write to

termsOfUseContent.1-1: 1.1. This User Agreement (hereinafter â€” the Â«AgreementÂ») regulates the relationship between the administration of the Sant Crois platform (hereinafter â€” the Â«AdministrationÂ») and the user (hereinafter â€” the Â«UserÂ») regarding the use of the website, Telegram bot, and other Sant Crois services.
termsOfUseContent.1-2: 1.2. By using Sant Crois services, the User confirms that they have read and accepted the terms of this Agreement in full.
termsOfUseContent.2-1: 2.1. Sant Crois provides access to educational materials, including lessons, exercises, and other resources designed for language learning.
termsOfUseContent.2-2: 2.2. The User agrees to use the platform only for personal educational purposes, without violating the law or the rights of third parties.
termsOfUseContent.2-3: 2.3. Teachers may use the platform to organize and conduct lessons, as well as to receive results of studentsâ€™ assignments.
termsOfUseContent.3-1: 3.1. All materials posted on the Sant Crois platform, including texts, images, audio, and video materials, are copyrighted and belong to the Administration or third parties that have granted the corresponding rights.
termsOfUseContent.3-2: 3.2. Copying, distribution, modification, or any other use of the materials is prohibited without prior written consent of the rights holder.
termsOfUseContent.4-1: 4.1. The Administration is not responsible for possible interruptions in the platformâ€™s operation, data loss, or other damages resulting from the use or inability to use Sant Crois services.
termsOfUseContent.4-2: 4.2. The User is fully responsible for all actions performed using the platform.
termsOfUseContent.5-1: 5.1. The Administration reserves the right to make changes to this Agreement at any time. Changes take effect from the moment they are published on the website.
termsOfUseContent.5-2: 5.2. Continued use of the platform after changes have been made means that the User agrees with the new terms.
termsOfUseContent.6-1: For any questions related to this Agreement, you can contact us at: sant-crois@gmail.com

privacy.1-1: 1.1. This Privacy Policy (hereinafter â€” the Â«PolicyÂ») describes how the Sant Crois platform (hereinafter â€” Â«weÂ», Â«our serviceÂ») collects, uses, and protects usersâ€™ personal data (hereinafter â€” Â«youÂ», Â«UserÂ»).
privacy.1-2: 1.2. By using our website, Telegram bot, or other services, you agree to the terms of this Policy.
privacy.2-1: 2.1. We use the collected data for:
privacy.2-4: Maintaining communication with users (e.g., for feedback);
privacy.3-1: 3.1. We do not share your personal data with third parties without your consent, except as required by law.
privacy.4-1: 4.1. We take all necessary technical and organizational measures to protect your data from unauthorized access, alteration, or destruction.
privacy.4-2: 4.2. Data is stored only as long as necessary for the purposes specified in this Policy.
privacy.5-2: Request access to your personal data;
privacy.5-3: Request correction or deletion of your data;
privacy.5-4: Withdraw your consent to data processing;
privacy.5-5: File a complaint with the data protection authority.
privacy.6-1: 6.1. We may update this Policy. The current version is always available on our website.
privacy.7-1: If you have any questions about personal data processing, please contact us at:

cookie.1-1: 1.1. Cookies are small text files stored on your device when you visit a website. They help improve your user experience by remembering your preferences and actions.
cookie.2-1: 2.1. We may use the following types of cookies:
cookie.2-2: Essential â€” required for the proper functioning of the website.
cookie.2-3: Functional â€” remember your settings (e.g., interface language).
cookie.2-4: Analytical â€” help us understand how users interact with the platform (e.g., Google Analytics).
cookie.2-5: Marketing â€” used to display more relevant ads (may not be used at the current stage, but worth mentioning for the future).
cookie.3-2: Save your interface language and settings;
cookie.3-3: Improve website performance and identify errors;
cookie.3-4: Analyze user behavior to improve content and interface.
cookie.4-1: 4.1. You can manage cookies in your browser settings â€” delete, block, or allow them.
cookie.4-2: 4.2. Please note: disabling cookies may affect the functionality of the website.
cookie.5-1: 5.1. We may update this Policy. Changes take effect once published on the website.
cookie.6-1: If you have any questions about the use of cookies, please contact us at
